title: Julio FernÃ¡ndez, Filmax Founder, Fantastic Factory Co-Creator, Dies at 78
description: Julio FernÃ¡ndez, the pioneering founder of Barcelona studio Filmax and co-architect of itsFantastic Factory which galvanised Spainâ€™s auteur genre pr
body:
Julio FernÃ¡ndez, the pioneering founder of Barcelona studio Filmax and co-architect of itsFantastic Factory which galvanised Spainâ€™s auteur genre production, died Nov. 17. in Miami. He was 78.

	Born in rural Galicia, in A Fonsagrada in the province of Lugo, FernÃ¡ndez was typical of a region which emigrated for larger opportunities in Spainâ€™s fast building cities. Few, however, had FernÃ¡ndezâ€™s ambitions and eye for the main chance. If genre and animation are two of the current international marketâ€™s going concerns, FernÃ¡ndez anticipated this getting on for 30 years ago.Â 
	

	In 1987, FernÃ¡ndez bought Filmax, a Paramount library movie distributor in the 1960s, dedicated to video, but which FernÃ¡ndez and younger brother Carlos FernÃ¡ndez wanted to move into theatrical distribution. Buoyed by cinema theater results for â€œThe Fourth Consul,â€ Filmax made another move, into production, and always with one eye on international markets, seeing vibrant international sales on young director Jaume BalaguerÃ³â€™s â€œNamelessâ€ at 1999â€™s Mifed, bringing down the flag on a golden age of Spanish auteur genre.


	A year later, FernÃ¡ndez officially launched the Fantastic Factory with Brian Yuzna. A unique attempt to replicate the shlock but also meta arch awareness of 1985â€™s â€œRe-Animatorâ€ in movies made in English in Spain mixing international and Spanish actors, the Fantastic Factory saw early success, with Lionsgate Entertainment acquiring all North American rights to four of its horror titles: Jack Sholderâ€™s â€œArachnidâ€; â€œDagon,â€ from Stuart Gordon; and two titles from Brian Yuzna: â€œFaust: Love of the Damnedâ€ and â€œBeyond Re-Animator.â€Â 
	

	In 2001, FernÃ¡ndez launched Filmax Animation in his native Galicia, a venture which yielded Goya-winning â€œEl Cid: The Legend.â€ Filmax also upped its ambition. Bought by Dimension and released in 2004 two years after its Spanish bow, supernatural horror film â€œDarknessâ€ â€“ starring Anna Paquin,Â Lena Olin,Â Iain GlenÂ andÂ Giancarlo Giannini and a step-up in scale and step into English for BalaguerÃ³ â€“ grossed a breakout $34.4 million in U.S. theaters.Â 

	Also released in 2004, the Brad Anderson-directed â€œThe Machinist,â€ starring Christian Bale, has become a cult classic. From BalaguerÃ³ and Paco Plaza, â€œ[REC],â€ which premiered in 2007, went on to be ranked by Bloody Disgusting at No. 11 of its Top 20 Horror Films of the 2000s.Â Â  Â 

	In 2010, Carlos FernÃ¡ndez took over the reins of the company as its president, consolidating TV production, scoring a huge success with series â€œPolseres Vermellesâ€ (â€œThe Red Band Societyâ€) remade by Fox in the U.S. and one of Spainâ€™s most successful TV fiction formats ever. He and Filmax co-head Laura Fernandez, Julio FernÃ¡ndezâ€™s daughter, have also fully-diversified Filmax into a full-blown studio.Â 

	Julio FernÃ¡ndez was a born entrepreneur, working in sectors from real estate to cured sausages, the latter in Galicia.Â 

	From 2010, he increasingly turned to other enterprises. His legacy remains, however. The Fantastic Factory underscored the possibilities of genre as a business and an art-form in Spain. It may be no coincidence that when Guillermo del Toro set out to shoot â€œPanâ€™s Labyrinth,â€ still reckoned by many as his best film, he shot and majority financed it in the country. The seeds of Spainâ€™s modern genre film industry had already been sown.

schema.headline: Julio FernÃ¡ndez, Filmax Founder, Fantastic Factory Co-Creator, Dies at 78

title: Dwayne Johnson to Be Honored by the American Black Film Festival (EXCLUSIVE)
description:
Dwayne Johnson will be honored at the 8th American Black Film Festival in February.

	The â€œSmashing Machineâ€ star will receive the Entertainment Ico
body:
Dwayne Johnson will be honored at the 8th American Black Film Festival in February.

	The â€œSmashing Machineâ€ star will receive the Entertainment Icon Award. Presented by Nice Crowd, the 2026 ABFF Honors will take place on Feb. 16 at the SLS Hotel in Beverly Hills.

	â€œDwayne Johnson is the very definition of an entertainment icon,â€ said Nice Crowds co-CEOs and presidents Jeff Friday and Nicole Friday. â€œFrom his trailblazing career in sports entertainment to his extraordinary success in film and television, he has become one of the most influential and beloved figures in global culture. His journey embodies the power of perseverance, authenticity, and charisma â€” values that reflect the spirit of ABFF. We are thrilled to honor him with this yearâ€™s Entertainment Icon Award and to celebrate his incredible contributions to the world of entertainment.â€
	

	Johnson stars in A24â€™s â€œThe Smashing Machine,â€ directed by Benny Safdie, as MMA fighter Mark Kerr. The film tells the story of Kerrâ€™s rise to fame and his battle with addiction. Emily Blunt co-stars as his girlfriend. â€œThe Smashing Machineâ€ premiered in September at the Venice International Film Festival, where it won the Silver Lion.


	READ MORE: Dwayne Johnson, Emily Blunt and Benny Safdieâ€™s Underdog â€˜The Smashing Machineâ€™: In a Topsy-Turvy Year, Donâ€™t Count Them Out for Oscars GloryÂ 

	As previously announced, Oscar-winner and talk show host Jennifer Hudson will receive the Renaissance Award, the Evolution Award will go to director and executive producer Salli Richardson-Whitfield and â€œF1â€ star Damson Idris will be recognized with the Horizon Award.
	

	ABFF Honors will also pay a special tribute to the creative team behind â€œSinners,â€ Ryan Cooglerâ€™s hit horror movie starring Michael B. Jordan.

	The event will be hosted by New York Times best-selling author and award-winning comedian KevOnStage.

schema.headline: Dwayne Johnson to Be Honored by the American Black Film Festival (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Hollywood Commission Launches New Anti-Harassment Resources For Entertainment Workers -Film News in Brief
description: The Hollywood Commission has released new online resources designed to simplify and support anti-harassment practices, particularly for independent
body:
The Hollywood Commission has released new online resources designed to simplify and support anti-harassment practices, particularly for independent and low-budget productions, as part of its â€œRespect on Setâ€ initiative.

	â€œRespect on Setâ€ is a program developed by the Hollywood Commission that offers producers resources and guidelines to create a safer and inclusive work environment. Developed in close collaboration with INDIEnâ€”ncomposed of producers Jeanette Volturno, Monica Levinson and Bart Rosenblattnâ€”nthe new â€œRespect on Setâ€ tools bring industry-aligned best practices, templates, and implementation resources together in one place.
	

	While surveying entertainment workers, the Hollywood Commission found that compared to their major-studio counterparts, workers on low-budget productions experience more sexual coercion and assault, but have fewer tools and support to report or prevent these abuses.


	â€œRespect on Setâ€ was created to provide independent productions with a digital toolkit that delivers sample codes of conduct, customizable policy templates, pre-production audit and implementation checklist, communication tools, training resources and practical guidance for fulfilling IATSE LBA responsibilities.



	

									Courtesy photo
	



	Leonardo DiCaprio Honored by Palm Springs International Film Awards

	Leonardo DiCaprio will be honored with the Desert Palm Achievement Award, Actor for his performance in Paul Thomas Andersonâ€™s â€œOne Battle After Anotherâ€ at the Palm Springs International Film Awards. The awards take place Jan. 3 at the Palm Springs Convention Center. 
	

	â€œIn â€˜One Battle After Another,â€™ Leonardo DiCaprio delivers a riveting and emotionally charged performance, embodying a man pushed to his breaking point in the face of relentless adversity,â€ said Festival Chairman Nachhattar Singh Chandi in a statement. â€œAcross his career, DiCaprio has continually redefined what is possible in screen acting â€” bringing emotional depth, artistic integrity, and fearless commitment to every role. It is our honor to present him with the Desert Palm Achievement Award, Actor, in recognition of his enduring influence and exceptional body of work.â€

	Previously announced honorees include Michael B. Jordan (Icon Award), Adam Sandler (Chairmanâ€™s Award) and Sentimental Value cast members Renate Reinsve, Stellan SkarsgÃ¥rd, Inga Ibsdotter Lilleaas, and Elle Fanning (International Star Award).

schema.headline: Hollywood Commission Launches New Anti-Harassment Resources For Entertainment Workers -Film News in Brief

title: All Reality: AMC Networks Launches New Streamer for Unscripted Programming
description: AMC Networks has launched a new streaming service titled All Reality, available as an add-on to Prime Video for $4.99 per month, with more platforms
body:
AMC Networks has launched a new streaming service titled All Reality, available as an add-on to Prime Video for $4.99 per month, with more platforms coming soon.

	The streamer features reality franchises from We TV and other brands under the AMC umbrella, including â€œLove After Lockup,â€ â€œThe Braxtons,â€ â€œMama Juneâ€ and a new iteration of â€œBridezillasâ€ narrated by Tamar Braxton, which will be the first original series on All Reality. 


	The service launched Tuesday with 2,500 hours of reality television and more series to come. Every season of â€œGrowing Up Hip Hopâ€ and â€œMarriage Boot Campâ€ will be available, as well as new episodes of â€œThe Graham Norton Show.â€ Plus, there are anthology series like â€œTrue Crime Story: It Couldnâ€™t Happen Here,â€ hosted by Hilarie Burton Morgan.
	

	â€œAMC Networks has produced some of the most compelling stories on television â€“ from our award-winning original dramas to popular, long-running reality franchises with characters and plot twists that rival even the most dramatic scripted fare,â€ said Courtney Thomasma, the companyâ€™s executive vice president of linear and streaming products. â€œAs the home of the worldâ€™s largest collection of targeted streaming services, we are thrilled to bring reality TV viewers the programming they love most, available for the first time on a single streaming platform in the U.S. â€“ All Reality. With thousands of hours of unapologetically addictive reality TV, including new installments of iconic franchises like â€˜Bridezillas,â€™ weâ€™re excited to bring fans more of the drama they canâ€™t get enough of, with none of the filler.â€

schema.headline: All Reality: AMC Networks Launches New Streamer for Unscripted Programming

title: â€˜Twisted Metalâ€™ Renewed for Season 3, David Reed Takes Over as Showrunner
description:
â€œTwisted Metalâ€ has been renewed for Season 3 at Peacock, Variety has learned. 

	In addition, Michael Jonathan Smith â€” who co-created the series an
body:
â€œTwisted Metalâ€ has been renewed for Season 3 at Peacock, Variety has learned. 

	In addition, Michael Jonathan Smith â€” who co-created the series and has served as showrunner for the first two seasons â€” will be exiting the show. David Reed will board the series as showrunner and executive producer for Season 3 under an overall deal with Sony Pictures Television. 

	â€œTwisted Metalâ€ Season 2 debuted on Peacock in July. The series stars Anthony Mackie, Stephanie Beatriz, Joe Seanoa and Will Arnett. Per NBCUniversal, the second season has tallied 993 million minutes viewed to date, making it Peacockâ€™s second biggest returning original scripted season. 
	

	The series is based on the Playstation game franchise of the same name. The official description for Season 2 states: 


	â€œFollowing the revelations in the season one finale, John (Mackie) and Quiet (Beatriz) find themselves entering the deadly Twisted Metal tournament, a sinister demolition derby hosted by a mysterious man known as Calypso (Anthony Carrigan). As they try to survive an onslaught of dangerous new foes and familiar faces alike, including the murderous clown Sweet Tooth (played by Seanoa, voiced by Arnett), things get complicated for John when he reunites with his long-lost sister, the vigilante Dollface (Tiana Okoye).â€

	Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick also co-created the show and will executive produce along with Reed. Arnett and Marc Forman executive produce via Electric Ave, along with Mackie via Make It Gravy Productions, Jason Spire of Inspire Entertainment, Peter Principato of Artists First, Asad Qizilbash and Carter Swan from PlayStation Productions, and Hermen Hulst, CEO of Sony Interactive Entertainmentâ€™s Studio Business. The series is produced by Sony Pictures Television, PlayStation Productions, and Universal Television. 
	

	Reedâ€™s recent credits include the hit Amazon series â€œThe Boysâ€ as well as the Paramount+ series â€œStar Trek: Strange New Worlds.â€ Additionally, he has written for shows like â€œThe Magicians,â€ â€œSupernatural,â€ and â€œAquarius,â€ while he has also sold pilots to BBC Worldwide, CBS, Tomorrow Studios, and FX. He has also written novels, comic books, and video games over the course of his career. 

	Reed is repped by WME, Villains Entertainment and Jackoway Tyerman.

schema.headline: â€˜Twisted Metalâ€™ Renewed for Season 3, David Reed Takes Over as Showrunner

title: How I Became the Woman Hollywood Calls When the Impossible Needs to Happen
description: When people ask me what itâ€™s like to run an events company, I always say that it depends on the answers to the type of seemingly unusual questions I
body:
When people ask me what itâ€™s like to run an events company, I always say that it depends on the answers to the type of seemingly unusual questions I find myself asking. And they often start as random as:â€œAnd how many custom trucks do we need?â€â€œHow many stops across the U.S.?â€â€œHow many months will we be on the road?â€â€œWhatâ€™s the guest count per stop?â€It always sounds impossible. I always say, â€œYes.â€

	Thatâ€™s how I found myself running one of the first major national tours for a new tech client. It was seven months on the road, 12 cities and roughly 2,500 guests per location. We customized entire trucks in a matter of weeks, tricked out with every detail the client dreamed up, including full kitchens capable of serving hot food, storage for tents and gear and enough AV options to rival a festival.
	

	We flew from state to state chasing permits from health departments and city officials â€” never totally sure weâ€™d get approvals until the eleventh hour. And naturally, at some point, one of the trucks broke down in the middle of nowhere.

	But my team never flinched. We exceeded expectations. We found the workaround. We always do. Our production manager ran the entire tour with a broken wrist in a cast, smiling (almost) the whole way, ready for each new city and its own unique brand of commotion.

	Thatâ€™s the kind of energy that keeps this machine, my company, running.

	And each event eventually hits a point where I take a step back for half a second, and watch it become something even bigger than what we planned. While those trucks tore down highways, fans began honking like we were a touring band. In more than one city, people actually trailed us all the way to the venue, phones out, wanting to catch the moment the doors swung open. Guests showed up hours before the official start time just to claim their spot at the front of the line. Somewhere between the honking caravans and the early-bird lines, the whole thing shifted. It wasnâ€™t an â€œeventâ€ and we werenâ€™t just building this thing. We were architecting a community in real time.
	

	I love running my company and am grateful every day for the incredible projects we get to be part of. But anyone who thinks this business is all glamour and no grit has never been in the trenches at 3 a.m. with a deadline closing in. Thereâ€™s no world where you shortcut your way out of a crisis. And thereâ€™s no existing AI agent you can summon when a client realizes the branding is wrong on hundreds of gloves hours before doors open and you need the best, most-trusted embroiderer in all of Manhattan right away (that particular night, we had just six hours to redo every glove, and get them back on-site before the first guest arrived). We made it happen. We always make it happen. Thatâ€™s the power of relationships. And when the client nods and says, â€œItâ€™s perfect. This is exactly what we wanted,â€ every minute under pressure becomes worth it.

	One evening on the night of an opening at the Brooklyn Navy Yard, rain came down in sheets just as the show was set to begin. Within mere minutes, we had sourced and distributed hundreds of umbrellas so guests stayed dry and the energy stayed intact.

	Iâ€™ve taken 2 a.m. crisis calls, while pregnant, troubleshooting a high-profile musician hired for a next day performance who now was unable to perform.

	These are the moments the public never sees. Theyâ€™re also the moments that define my career. Thatâ€™s the part no one teaches you: Relentlessness. You earn it through rolling up sleeves and the feeling of precision and the sense of responsibility that you owe yourself and your clients. When you do what you love, itâ€™s a process that becomes extremely sacred and personal. We treat every event like weâ€™re hosting people in our own home: The pacing, warmth and the way the experience unfolds. Everything is intentional. Everything is designed to feel effortless.

	And then there are the requests that arrive out of (almost) thin air. On the morning of a VIP preview, a partner decided on a very exciting pivot. We needed 3,000 green plastic balls for a last-minute immersive forest lake installation. The only issue: Every, and I mean every, single store sold them in multicolor packs. So we sent teams all over Southern California, bought out the inventory and hand-sorted thousands of balls until only the green ones remained. Guests, and all of the internet as the project trended, saw a perfect, seamless installation. Theyâ€™ll never know what it took, and honestly, thatâ€™s the point. We donated the balls to a local school after for their play-yard, all of the colors, to minimize waste.
	

	Thatâ€™s why clients come to us and stay with us: They know we will say yes; they know we will perform; and they know the outcome will shape the future of their brand. We say yes because thereâ€™s no event weâ€™ve faced to date where we havenâ€™t excitedly figured it out. We anticipate needs, we have a network that spans industries and time zones, and we are uncompromising in the way we solve problems.

	â€œNoâ€ isnâ€™t in our vocabulary at Gold Sky. The only question is â€œhow?â€. And in an era obsessed with shortcuts and automation, weâ€™ve proven again and again that while it can help, in our industry nothing beats deep experience, a commitment to excellence, years of business relationships, and the instinct and intuition necessary for the kind of hospitality that makes people feel something real. That makes people feel they are part of something larger.

	At Gold Sky, that feeling is everything. Itâ€™s what turns an event into an experience, and an experience into a memory: The unforgettable moments building community in real time, where people show up, connect, and soon realize theyâ€™ve just stepped into one hell of an event.

schema.headline: How I Became the Woman Hollywood Calls When the Impossible Needs to Happen

title: American Cinematheque to Program Westwoodâ€™s Village Theater, Aiming for 2027 Opening
description: Westwoodâ€™s historic Village Theater, which was acquired by the Village Directors Circle, will partner with the American Cinematheque to program and
body:
Westwoodâ€™s historic Village Theater, which was acquired by the Village Directors Circle, will partner with the American Cinematheque to program and operate the venue. The partnership was announced Tuesday by Cinematheque chair Rick Nicita and Jason Reitman.

	The theater in Los Angelesâ€™ Westwood Village will continue to host major premieres plus first-run films and retrospective programming, with the goal to open in 2027.


	Led by Reitman, the group of filmmakers that took over the theater in early 2024 is now known as the Village Directors Circle. More than 30 directors are involved, including Steven Spielberg, Denis Villeneuve, Lulu Wang, J.J. Abrams, Ryan Coogler, James Gunn, ChloÃ© Zhao, Guillermo del Toro, Christopher Nolan and Gina Prince-Bythewood.
	

	The Directors Circle has committed to fundraising to restore and remodel the hundred-year-old movie palace into a multi-purpose screening and event facility. The American Cinematheque will program, manage and be the operating partner for the 1,000 seat-plus venue, with participation from the filmmakers.

	Reitman said in a statement, â€œLast year, some of the greatest living directors rallied to save a Los Angeles monument, the Village Theater in Westwood. We often like to think of movie theaters as churches. If so, the Village is a cathedral, and with the American Cinematheque, we found our congregation.â€

	In addition to programming new theatrical releases, the theater will host special sceenings with in-person conversations, awards season events, retrospectives and tributes, as well as the Cinemathequeâ€™s programming such as Beyond Fest, Bleak Week, This Is Not a Fiction and Ultra Cinematheque 70. 
	

	In the lobby, the theater will exhibit artifacts from the collections of Directors Circle members and include concessions, retail kiosks and an event space for premieres. 

	â€œPartnering with the brilliant and virtuoso Village Directors Circle to renovate the Village Theater is an exciting milestone for the American Cinematheque. We are thrilled to bring our expertise in film programming to Westwood, breathing new life into this iconic venue. Our goal is to create a vibrant cultural hub that not only celebrates cinema but also enriches the community and welcomes audiences from all over Los Angeles and the world,â€ Nicita said. 

	Reitman added, â€œThe American Cinematheque shares the directorsâ€™ vision for showcasing new work, rediscovering classics, and building filmmaker-curated programs. The Village Theater has also been the home for show-stopping Hollywood premieres since 1930, and weâ€™re committed to carrying that tradition forward. We want to give audiences a place to experience the films they love with the people they love.â€

	Reitman and the Cinematheque are in the â€œquiet phaseâ€ of a $25 million capital campaign to transform the space, and Reitman said in the statement he is â€œvery excited by early leadership commitments by individuals and a major technology sponsor, with construction scheduled to commence early next year.â€

	The other filmmakers involved in the effort are Judd Apatow, Damien Chazelle, Chris Columbus, Bradley Cooper, Alfonso CuarÃ³n, Jonathan Dayton, Valerie Faris, Hannah Fidell, Alejandro GonzÃ¡lez IÃ±Ã¡rritu, Sian Heder, Gil Kenan, Karyn Kusama, Justin Lin, Phil Lord, David Lowery, Christopher McQuarrie, Chris Miller, Alexander Payne, Todd Phillips, Jay Roach, Seth Rogen, Emma Seligman, Brad Silberling and Emma Thomas.

schema.headline: American Cinematheque to Program Westwoodâ€™s Village Theater, Aiming for 2027 Opening

title: Ariana Grande Calls Her â€˜Eternal Sunshineâ€™ Tour the â€˜Last Hurrahâ€™: â€˜Might Not Happen Again for a Long Timeâ€™
description: Ariana Grande is doubling down on the status of her upcoming â€œEternal Sunshineâ€ tour. The singer and actress is returning to the stage for her first
body:
Ariana Grande is doubling down on the status of her upcoming â€œEternal Sunshineâ€ tour. The singer and actress is returning to the stage for her first arena tour in seven years. Grande said in an interview on Amy Poehlerâ€™s Good Hang podcast that the trek will be a one-time event, with no plans for future tours.

	â€œThe last 10 or 15 years will look very different to the ones that are coming up,â€ Grande told Poehler. â€œI donâ€™t want to say anything definitive. I do know that Iâ€™m very excited to do this small tour, but I think it might not happen again for a long, long, long, long, long time. Iâ€™m going to give it my all and itâ€™s going to be beautiful. I think thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m doing it because Iâ€™m like, â€˜One last hurrah!â€™â€
	

	The â€œEternal Sunshineâ€ Tour kicks off on June 6 in Oakland, Calif., and makes stops across the country in cities including Los Angeles, Austin, Atlanta, Brooklyn, Boston and more, before wrapping up in North America in Chicago on Aug. 5. She will go on to perform a string of 10 shows in London.

	Grande also opened up about her character in the upcoming comedy film, â€œFocker In-Law,â€ as part of the â€œMeet the Parentsâ€ franchise. â€œMy character is a triathlete,â€ she said. â€œI spent yesterday doing burpees and high knees with Robert De Niro. Iâ€™m like, â€˜What is this movie? What are we doing?â€™ But Iâ€™m having a blast. Itâ€™s really special.â€

	Watch the video below.

schema.headline: Ariana Grande Calls Her â€˜Eternal Sunshineâ€™ Tour the â€˜Last Hurrahâ€™: â€˜Might Not Happen Again for a Long Timeâ€™

title: â€˜Line of Dutyâ€™ Returns for Season 7 With Martin Compston, Vicky McClure and Adrian Dunbar Reprising Roles
description:
â€œLine of Duty,â€ the hit BBC crime drama that last aired in 2021, is set to make its return. 

	The show â€”Â created by Jed Mercurio and produced by Wo
body:
â€œLine of Duty,â€ the hit BBC crime drama that last aired in 2021, is set to make its return. 

	The show â€”Â created by Jed Mercurio and produced by World Productions â€”Â is coming back for a seventh season, with lead stars Martin Compston, Vicky McClure and Adrian Dunbar reprising their roles.

	In the upcoming six-part season, the fictional police anti-corruption unit AC-12 has been disbanded and rebranded the Inspectorate of Police Standards. Anti-corruption work has never been more difficult and in this challenging climate Steve Arnott (Compston), Kate Fleming (McClure) and Ted Hastings (Dunbar) are assigned their most sensitive case so far. Detective Inspector Dominic Gough, a charismatic officer winning plaudits for a string of takedowns of organised crime, is accused of abusing his position of trust to act as a sexual predator. But is Goughâ€™s case a deliberate distraction from a bigger threat still operating in the shadows?
	

	Season seven will start filming in Belfast in Spring 2026, with further cast to be announced in due course.


	â€œEveryone involved in Line of Duty feels enormous gratitude to the showâ€™s fans,â€ said Mercurio. â€œWeâ€™re privileged to have had so many of you follow the ups and downs of AC-12 over six previous seasons and we couldnâ€™t be more delighted to be returning for a seventh. Corruption in this country is supposed to have come to an end while Line of Duty was off air so Iâ€™ve been forced to use my imagination.â€

	â€œLine of Dutyâ€ last aired in 2021, and the series six finale was the U.K.â€™s biggest drama episode [excluding soap operas] since modern records began in 2002, with 17 million viewers after 28 days. The series averaged a huge 16 million viewers, making it the biggest drama across the market since 2018. In the U.S. and Canada, BritBox exclusively premiered the sixth season.
	

	â€œThere have been a number of significant reunions in recent years, but few more keenly anticipated than the return of AC12,â€ said Simon Heath, World Productionsâ€™ CEO and creative director. â€œItâ€™s a privilege to be back with Jedâ€™s terrific new chapter of the Line of Duty story.â€

	Added Lindsay Salt, director of BBC Drama: â€œLine of Duty is beloved by audiences and critics alike and its amazing ratings are a true testament to the success of Jedâ€™s writing, the work from the brilliant team at World Productions and the entire cast and crew. Iâ€™m so pleased that after four long years Line of Duty will be back filming soon and canâ€™t wait for BBC viewers to be back on the edge of their seats.â€

	â€œLine of Dutyâ€ is written and created by Jed Mercurio and made by World Productions, part of ITV Studios, which is handling international distribution. It will be directed by Jennie Darnell and the producer is Ken Horn. The executive producers are Mercurio, Heath for World Productions and Nick Lambon for the BBC. â€œLine of Dutyâ€ is made with support from Northern Ireland Screen.

	â€œAs we count down the AC12 days of Christmas what a joy it is to know that the Three Amigos will be back filming together next year,â€ said Dunbar. â€œDelighted with the news and looking forward to those mercurial twists and turns.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Line of Dutyâ€™ Returns for Season 7 With Martin Compston, Vicky McClure and Adrian Dunbar Reprising Roles

title: PBSâ€™ Frontline Launches Production and Distribution Arm Frontline Features
description: After garnering the 2024 Oscar for the Ukraine war documentary â€œ20 Days in Mariupol,â€ Frontlineâ€™s editor-in-chief and executive producer Raney Arons
body:
After garnering the 2024 Oscar for the Ukraine war documentary â€œ20 Days in Mariupol,â€ Frontlineâ€™s editor-in-chief and executive producer Raney Aronson-Rath knew that, despite streamersâ€™ aversion to political fare, audiences around the world were hungry for investigative journalistic content. Aronson-Rathâ€™s conviction has led to the formation of Frontline Features, a new documentary production and distribution initiative.

	The first four official Frontline Features productions include two Oscar contenders â€” â€œ2000 Meters to Andriivkaâ€ and â€œAntidoteâ€ â€” the short doc â€œStatus: Venezuelan,â€ and an upcoming feature documentary, â€œOne in a Million.â€
	

	The new banner will be led by Aronson-Rath, an Oscar-winning producer who has expanded the PBS Frontline seriesâ€™ traditional broadcast reporting into the critically acclaimed documentary space. Under Aronson-Rathâ€™s leadership, Frontline has earned three Academy Award nominations since 2018 for â€œAbacus: Small Enough to Jail,â€ â€œFor Sama,â€ and â€œ20 Days in Mariupol,â€ which garnered the Oscar for best documentary feature in 2024.


	â€œI see Frontline Features as an extension of our [Frontline] mission â€” to produce trustworthy, impactful journalism thatâ€™s widely accessible to all audiences,â€ says Aronson-Rath.

	Each year, Frontline Features will either commission or come in at the early stages of three to five doc projects â€” both features and shorts. Each film will premiere at a festival, go on the fest circuit, and then have a theatrical run of at least two weeks.

	â€œWe would prefer to partner with theaters like we recently did with the Film Forum on â€˜2000 Meters to Andriivka,'â€ Aronson-Rath says. â€œBut we will just be strategic because we really do believe in the power of the theater. We believe in people convening and being together. It sounds so simple, but it really is so powerful still.â€
	

	A Frontline Features docâ€™s theatrical release will be followed by a PBS broadcast debut and a worldwide streaming launch on PBS App and YouTube, under PBSâ€™s multiyear deal with the streaming giant. The Frontline YouTube channel has 3.2 million subscribers and offers more than 70 feature-length films and over 300 Frontline documentaries.

	â€œHopefully, our contribution to the documentary community is that Frontline Features films start with distribution,â€ says Aronson-Rath. â€œWe canâ€™t do everything. We canâ€™t fix the whole marketplace, but we can contribute because we really do believe in the documentary form as a form. Platforms have films, but for us, we have a different mission in mind, which is to ensure that these films are seen. They should be in front of the paywall and should be accessible to everyone. So, itâ€™s a different strategy, but I think itâ€™s a really important one. I mean, it shouldnâ€™t be the only strategy, but it certainly is a good strategy for a world that needs these films.â€

	â€œ20 Days in Mariupol,â€ directed by Pulitzer Prize-winning AP journalist Mstyslav Chernov, screened at 350 theaters worldwide and currently has 3.7 million views on YouTube.

	â€œBefore I made â€™20 Days in Mariupol,â€™ I knew as a journalist investigator, how hard things are in the documentary community and for those people who make social impact of films because they are not easy to watch and because sometimes they are political,â€ says Chernov. â€œCertain streamers or distributors donâ€™t want to deal with those topics. They would rather deal with more entertaining topics. But Frontline has never been afraid to deal with these difficult topics, and they have this dedicated audience. So, Frontline Features is exciting because everybody seems to be doing worse and worse in our community. So for someone to actually make an attempt to expand the reach and to make a bigger impact, and to support more filmmakers â€” itâ€™s invaluable.â€

	According to Aronson-Rath, young people are watching Frontline doc features on mobile devices, which is why her team will create short clips from the feature films for Instagram and other social media platforms.

	â€œMini shorts reach millions of people,â€ says Aronson-Rath. â€œHopefully, those will bring people back to the long form. We are taking a very wide-reaching, audience-driven approach to this, so we can reach people all across the globe.â€
	

	Paula Kerger, President and CEO of PBS,Â says, â€œFrontline Features is an exciting evolution of our longstanding commitment to serving audiences with trusted journalism.â€

	The Frontline Features division will be led by Frontlineâ€™s senior editorial team. The Frontline Features advisory council will be led by Oscar-winning filmmaker Nina Fialkow, and will include filmmakers and journalists such as Simon Kilmurry, Michelle Mizner, Dan Edge, and Chernov.

	â€œIâ€™m very devoted to the whole idea of public television and, in particular, Frontline,â€ says Fialkow, a leading member of Impact Partners. â€œI believe in fact-based journalistic documentaries, and I want to continue to support the documentary community and support Raney in the best way that I can.â€

	â€œ2000 Meters to Andriivkaâ€ is the latest collaboration between Fronline and The Associated Press. Frontlineâ€™s â€œStatus: Venezuelanâ€ is in partnership with ProPublica and premiered at Double Exposure Film Festival and the upcoming â€œOne in a Millionâ€ was made in partnership with BBC Storyville and will premiere in 2026.

	Frontline is supported by PBS, various foundations, and individual financial contributors.

schema.headline: PBSâ€™ Frontline Launches Production and Distribution Arm Frontline Features

title: 'Selling the OC' Gives Sugar Daddy Dating Site Major Boost
description:
'Selling the OC'
                          Former 'Sugar Dating' Site Booming After Shout-Out
body:
'Selling the OC'
                          Former 'Sugar Dating' Site Booming After Shout-Out
                      
                  
                        Published November 18, 2025 11:26 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          "Selling the OC" has really given "sugar daddy" seekers a major boost ... cuz this season they're peddling more than just homes -- with one dating site seeing a big boost of visitors.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Here's the deal ... on Season 4 of "Selling the OC," a website once used to connect thirsty young ladies with sugar daddies has been all the talk -- ever since Ashtyn was accused of meeting her husband, Jeff, on the site.
      
    
          Turns out that's been great for business, because a rep for Seeking.com -- formally known as Seeking Arrangements -- tells us they've seen a major spike in women looking to live the good life jumping on the site ... especially in Washington D.C., L.A., Orlando, NYC and Miami.
      

      
        
              
    
    
          But don't quit those day jobs just yet, ladies ... because we're told the site rebranded in 2022 and no longer condones or endorses "sugar dating" -- and doesn't allow arrangements on the site. In other words, it's no longer the place to try to swindle lonely, rich, old bachelors. Now, Seeking.com operates as a "luxe" site where equally successful individuals can match.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As for whether Ashtyn is a registered user of Seeking.com, the site tells us, "We're not able to confirm or deny."

title: Man Sets Woman on Fire During Argument on Chicago Train, Cops Say
description:
Chicago
                          Woman Riding on Train Set on Fire
                          ...
body:
Chicago
                          Woman Riding on Train Set on Fire
                          ... Suspect Still at Large
                      
                  
                        Published November 18, 2025 9:58 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          A woman is reportedly in critical condition after a man allegedly set her on fire in the middle of an argument on a busy Chicago train Monday.
      
    
          According to Chicago's WGN-TV, a 26-year-old woman and a man believed to be about 45 years old got into a heated argument that became physical around 9:30 PM Monday. The outlet reports the man poured some sort of liquid onto the woman and ignited it, setting her on fire.
      
    
          The man reportedly fled the scene when the train came to a stop in the city's Loop -- a downtown business area known for tourist-friendly shopping and dining. The woman collapsed on the platform.
      

          The incident drew a large police and fire response, with personnel swarming the scene. Police said the victim had been extinguished by the time they arrives ... paramedics reportedly transported the woman to the hospital, where she was listed in critical condition from severe burns to her body and face.
      
    
          A witness told WGN, "I just saw her lying on the ground, and she was kinda hyperventilating and in a lot of pain, and she was really in bad shape."
      
    
          The Chicago Police Department is investigating ... no one has been arrested.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles

schema.headline: Man Sets Woman on Fire During Argument on Chicago Train, Cops Say

title: Famous Entertainment Duo Kessler Twins Dead at 89 on Same Day
body:
THE KESSLER TWINS
                          DEAD AT 89
                      
                  
                        Published November 18, 2025 6:35 AM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated November 18, 2025 12:12 PM PST
                                    
      
    
          Alice and Ellen Kessler -- German twin entertainers who performed together and rose to fame in the 1950s and â€™60s -- have reportedly died after choosing to end their lives together.
      
    
          According to the German news outlet Bild, the former dynamic duo died at their home near Munich, Germany by assisted suicide.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The publication reports the Kesslers â€œno longer wanted to liveâ€ and â€œthey had chosen to end their lives together.â€ Authorities were reportedly alerted after they died.
      

          In Germany, assisted dying is allowed in certain circumstances, following a 2020 ruling by the country's highest court, which found people have the right to end their own lives and receive third-party assistance -- as long as their decision is being made freely and without outside pressure.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Last year, the Kessler twins told Bild they wanted their ashes placed in the same urn ... and be buried alongside their mother and their dog.
      
    
          The sisters became famous for their singing and dancing ... and throughout their illustrious career shared the stage with legends like Frank Sinatra, Fred Astaire and Dean Martin.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Dubbed "The Nation's Legs," they were fixtures on Italian TV shows and even appeared on American staples like "The Ed Sullivan Show" and "The Dean Martin Show."
      
    
          Alice and Ellen were 89.
      
    
          RIP
      
    
          If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, help is available. Call or text 988 or chat 988lifeline.org.
